availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bazzel Standrod (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and magistrate)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and magistrate. North Carolina native. Married to Rebecca Rogers Standrod. Father of Minerva Standrod Holland, Drury W. Standrod, Samuel Standrod, Rebecca S. Standrod, and Sally A. Standrod. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1850. Magistrate and farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, 1st District, p. 321A; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 16-17; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 50; Find A Grave, "Bazzel Standrod (1797-1869)," Memorial #49596408, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=49596408&ref=acom (accessed March 9, 2017).
